page.title: 09Beverstone Church:Screen.
page.content: The rood screen stands beneath the fourteenth century chancel arch.The wood is very dark and ancient with some golden ornamentation.It consists of three bays with a more recent rood in lighter wood set above it.This was added in 1907.The screen itself has had an interesting history.It was removed in 1842 during the restoration ff the church.However,in the 1880's it was rescued from the rectory garden where it had been acting as a pergola! It has been conjectured that the screen was orginally made up of five bays and that it stood in front of the chancel arch.Behind the pulpit there is a doorway leading to stairs which originally gave access to the rood loft.
